x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.problem_statement:
Many students, teachers, and schools have surplus educational resources—such as books, lab kits, digital devices, and stationery—that often remain unused. At the same time, students and institutions in underprivileged or remote areas struggle to access these essential materials due to cost, location, or logistical barriers.
Existing sharing mechanisms are largely manual or fragmented: donations occur sporadically through social media groups, local NGOs, or individual contacts. This leads to:
Wastage of valuable resources.
Inequitable access to educational tools.
Inefficient tracking of what is donated, distributed, and received.
Missed opportunities to identify and address localized resource gaps.
The challenge is to create a centralized, automated system that allows resources to flow efficiently from donors to those who need them, while ensuring transparency, accountability, and measurable impact.

How do you envision the ideal solution to this  problem?

 

Which ServiceNow products or capabilities would be used?

  • ServiceNow Custom Tables: To store details of resources, donors, recipients, and requests.
  • Service Portal: User-friendly interface for students, teachers, and administrators to submit resources, make requests, and track allocations.
  • Workflows & Business Rules: Automate resource matching, approval processes, and notifications for donors/recipients.
  • Notifications & Alerts: Send reminders, updates on allocations, and delivery schedules.
  • Dashboards & Reporting: Track distribution metrics, resource types, geographic reach, and fulfillment success.
  • Virtual Agent: Enable a conversational interface for students, teachers, and NGOs to submit requests, check resource availability, and receive real-time guidance and updates.
  • Knowledge Management: Provide guidance on how to prepare, donate, or receive resources effectively.

 

Are there any technical dependencies for the proposed solution?

  • Internet access for students, teachers, and schools to use the ServiceNow portal.
  • Optional integration with logistics or courier services for automated delivery scheduling.
  • Data privacy and compliance considerations for storing student or school information.
  • Mobile responsiveness of the ServiceNow portal for remote or low-bandwidth users

 

What challenges would you foresee in implementing this idea?

  • Data Accuracy: Ensuring that resources logged by donors are accurate in quantity, condition, and availability.
  • Logistics & Delivery: Coordinating pickups and deliveries, especially for remote or rural areas.
  • User Adoption: Encouraging students, teachers, and schools to actively participate in submitting and requesting resources.
  • Resource Matching Complexity: Efficiently matching supply and demand based on location, type, and urgency without overwhelming administrators.
  • Privacy & Security: Safeguarding personal information of students, teachers, and schools.
  • Sustainability: Maintaining ongoing engagement and updates to prevent the system from becoming inactive after initial adoption.
